subject: Climate & Environment
title: How Wind Turbines Work
description: A 60-second lesson on How Wind Turbines Work.

hook.text: Wind is just air molecules moving from high pressure to low pressure. Turbines harvest that motion.

buildup.text: Blades are shaped like airplane wings. Moving air creates lift that spins the rotor.

discovery.text: The spinning rotor turns a generator inside the nacelle, converting motion into electricity.

twist.text: Turbines can only capture about 59% of wind energy. This is called the Betz limit.

climax.text: Modern turbines hit 45-50% efficiency â€” close to the theoretical maximum.

punchline.text: Wind pushes a wing, a wing spins a magnet, and lights turn on.

quiz.question: What is the Betz limit?
options: The maximum energy a turbine can extract from wind (~59%)
The tallest a turbine can be built
